text: How does the Python's range function work?
all,I am not really understand for loop in the following,can anyone give some tips?thanks in advance

code:
for i in range(5):
      print i

text: then it gives 0,1,2,3,4 is that python assign 0,1,2,3,4 to i at the same time?
then I call a, it gives 5 only, but if i add ''print a'' it gives 1,2,3,4,5 .So my question is what is the difference here?
i is a string or a list or something else?
or maybe can anyone help me to sort out:

code:

text: if i run this kind of code, then I will get the answer only when l=5...how can I make them start looping?i.e l=0 got values for vs[1],fs[1],rs[1], then l=1 got values for vs[2],rs[2],fs[2]......and so on.but python gives different arrays of fs,vs,rs, correspond to different value of l, how can I make them one piece?
